parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the consumer will wait for a response before it times out. Default value is 0, which means infinite.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the consumer will attempt to establish a connection before it times out. Default value is 0, which means infinite.

parameter.name: enableLogging
parameter.description: If this is true, requests and responses will be displayed in console log.

parameter.name: proxyHost
parameter.description: Hostname of the proxy. If this property is not set then no proxy will be used, otherwise a proxy will be used, but a proxy host must be specified.

parameter.name: proxyPort
parameter.description: Port of the proxy. If host is set then this property must be set and cannot be a negative number.

parameter.name: proxyUsername
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate against the proxy. If this property is not set then no authentication is going to be used against the proxy, otherwise this value must be specified.

parameter.name: proxyPassword
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username that you want to login with. Domain should not be included.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password for the user that you are going to login.

parameter.name: organizationServiceUrl
parameter.description: URL for the sharepoint instance that the connector is going to interact with.

parameter.name: disableCnCheck
parameter.description:
When dealing with HTTPS certificates, if the certificate is not signed by a trusted partner, the server might respond with an Exception.

To prevent this it is possible to disable the CN (Common Name) check.

Note: this is not recommended for production environments.

parameter.description: Username used to authenticate against the proxy. If this property is not set then no authentication is going to be used against the proxy, otherwise this value must be specified.

parameter.name: proxyPassword

parameter.name: authenticationRetries
parameter.description: If the authentication process against Microsoft Online fails the first time the connector will attempt to re-authenticate this many times.

parameter.name: stsMetadataUrl
parameter.description: (Optional) The STS's metadata exchange url. For ADFS this is usually https://mycompany-sts.com/adfs/services/trust/mex.

parameter.name: stsUsernamePortQname
parameter.description: (Optional) The name of port that accepts username/password credentials as described in the STS's metadata exchange url. This value has to be specified as a Qname in the format '{http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/securitytokenservice}UserNameWSTrustBinding_IWSTrust13Async'.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

parameter.name: logicalName
parameter.description: The logical name of the entity.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the record to which the related records are associated.

parameter.name: relationshipEntityRoleIsReferenced
parameter.description: false: when the primary entity record is Referencing the record to associate; true: when the primary entity record is Referenced by the record to associate.

parameter.name: relationshipSchemaName
parameter.description: The name of the relationship to create the link.

parameter.name: relatedEntitiesIds
parameter.description: A List<String> with the related entity records ids to associate.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: logicalName
parameter.description: The logical name of the entity.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The attributes of the record as a Map<String, Object>.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: logicalName
parameter.description: The logical name of the entity.

parameter.name: listOfAttributes
parameter.description: The list of attributes of the record as a List<Map<String, Object>>.

parameter.name: useSingleTransaction
parameter.description: If supported (CRM 2016 and above) use a single transaction to create all items, if anyone fails then rollback all.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.description: The logical name of the entity.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the record to delete.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: logicalName
parameter.description: The logical name of the entity.

parameter.name: ids
parameter.description: The ids of the records to delete.

parameter.description: If supported (CRM 2016 and above) use a single transaction to delete all items, if anyone fails then rollback all.

parameter.name: logicalName
parameter.description: The logical name of entity.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the record from which the related records are disassociated.

parameter.name: relationshipEntityRoleIsReferenced
parameter.description: false: when the primary entity record is Referencing the record to associate; true: when the primary entity record is Referenced by the record to associate.

parameter.name: relationshipSchemaName
parameter.description: The name of the relationship to delete the link.

parameter.name: relatedEntitiesIds
parameter.description: A List<String> with the related entity records ids to disassociate.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: execute
operation.description: Executes a message in the form of a request, and returns a response.

parameter.name: requestName
parameter.description: The logical name of request make.

parameter.name: requestParameters
parameter.description: [DEPRECATED] This parameter will be removed from the configuration in the near future. Set the #[payload] correctly before calling the connector.

parameter.name: requestId
parameter.description: The id of the request to make.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: executeMultiple
operation.description: Executes multiple messages in the form of a request, and returns their respective responses.

parameter.name: requests
parameter.description: This parameter is a list of the requests (OrganizationRequest or Map). Set the #[payload] correctly before calling the connector.

parameter.name: useSingleTransaction
parameter.description: If supported (CRM 2016 and above) use a single transaction to execute all requests, if anyone fails then rollback all.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: logicalName
parameter.description: The logical name of the entity.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the record to retrieve.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: retrieveMultipleByQuery
operation.description:
Retrieve multiple records.

The definition of the Microsoft XML Query Language can be found in the Schema Definition in this link: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg328332.aspx

The aggregation examples can be found in this link: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg328122.aspx

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: For DataSense Query Language, the DSQL query. For Native Query Language, the Fetch XML query.

parameter.name: itemsPerPage
parameter.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameter.name: singlePageNumber
parameter.description: If greater than 0, returns only that specific page.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The attributes to be updated as a Map<String, Object>.

parameter.name: listOfAttributes
parameter.description: The list of attributes of the record as a List<Map<String, Object>>.

parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message
